fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26683].
  {panel}

Currently JIRA will not allow number fields to be selected for many of the very useful dashboard statistics gadgets, this is a major limitation preventing users from displaying key statistics based on these number fields.

Take this example, our organization runs a deal review process that basically processes any new client request, capturing initial high level requirements, estimates and cost but we are not able to provide a dashboard to management with any statistics re these costs.

This was just one of many examples I can list, please consider this change ASAP.

Thank you!

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26647].
  {panel}

1. Launch Gliffy ( View issue - Add Gliffy Diagram )
2. Create new document dialog - choose - import a file as a template.
There is a suggestion about how to use GIF,PNG or JPEG images.
Suggestion refers to using 'Account Images'.
But Gliffy has no 'Account Images' tab, instead there is 'Issue Images' tab.
Suggestion should be changed appropriately.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26638].
  {panel}

Hi,

It would be great to have the ability to register listeners to be notified when the workflow entries associated with issues change state.

Currently, we can create listeners on three pre-existing built-in classes. None of them make you able to list directly on events processed by issues over the workflow. It's a question of have a listener similar to the mail one but differing on the resulting action.

This can be incredibly helpful when you need to perform operations that can only occur, for example, when the issue's workflow entry is in a particular state.

Cheers,
Matheus Fernandes
fields.summary: Ability to register listeners to be notified when the workflow entries associated with issues change state

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26630].
  {panel}

Hi,

it will be great to put Jira into a maintenance mode, when performing overall upgrades or configuration.

The maintenance mode can be
 - a Read-only mode
 - a page which tells that the system will be back in next time

Regards
Christina

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26626].
  {panel}

Attempting to place the caret when writing a comment often places it incorrectly (after a significant delay). May have to pinch-zoom first to reproduce.

Cannot view text being entered in a comment box while in landscape mode.

Attempting to select an item from a drop-down selects the wrong item.

Attempting to reload a page after entering an unsaved comment and confirming the reload, causes the browser to crash.

Browser has also crashed when viewing an image attachment, after pinch-zooming, and when viewing code changes in FishEye, after pinch-zooming.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26609].
  {panel}

The subject line reads:
[JIRA] Subscription: Tel:Waiting For Review For Greater Than 7 Days

The text inside says:
Filter: Tel:Waiting For Review For Greater Than 7 Days (0 issues)

It would be totally awesome if the subject line could include the issue count.
fields.summary: add issue count to subject of issue filter subscription email
Task and Sub-task(s) dependency
Log file size

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26605].
  {panel}

h5. Steps to reproduce:
* Integrate JIRA with Crowd for user management
* Within JIRA's administration panel, set DEBUG logging on the 'Default' level:
!^Default Logging - DEBUG.jpg|thumbnail!
* Log into JIRA as any Crowd user (in this case testuser / testpw)
* Notice this appear in both {{catalina.out}} and {{atlassian-jira.log}}:
{code}
2011-12-19 09:45:35,356 http-6060-11 DEBUG anonymous 585x185x1 r8vzf 192.168.15.171 /rest/gadget/1.0/login [httpclient.wire.header] >> "POST /crowd/rest/usermanagement/1/authentication?username=testuser HTTP/1.1[\r][\n]"
2011-12-19 09:45:35,356 http-6060-11 DEBUG anonymous 585x185x1 r8vzf 192.168.15.171 /rest/gadget/1.0/login [apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodBase] Adding Host request header
2011-12-19 09:45:35,356 http-6060-11 DEBUG anonymous 585x185x1 r8vzf 192.168.15.171 /rest/gadget/1.0/login [httpclient.wire.header] >> "Accept: application/xml[\r][\n]"
2011-12-19 09:45:35,356 http-6060-11 DEBUG anonymous 585x185x1 r8vzf 192.168.15.171 /rest/gadget/1.0/login [httpclient.wire.header] >> "Authorization: Basic amlyYTphZG1pbg==[\r][\n]"
2011-12-19 09:45:35,356 http-6060-11 DEBUG anonymous 585x185x1 r8vzf 192.168.15.171 /rest/gadget/1.0/login [httpclient.wire.header] >> "User-Agent: Jakarta Commons-HttpClient/3.0.1[\r][\n]"
2011-12-19 09:45:35,356 http-6060-11 DEBUG anonymous 585x185x1 r8vzf 192.168.15.171 /rest/gadget/1.0/login [httpclient.wire.header] >> "Host: dahmer:6095[\r][\n]"
2011-12-19 09:45:35,357 http-6060-11 DEBUG anonymous 585x185x1 r8vzf 192.168.15.171 /rest/gadget/1.0/login [httpclient.wire.header] >> "Cookie: $Version=0; JSESSIONID=346FF0812172877D5A48BFB90296B2E7; $Path=/crowd[\r][\n]"
2011-12-19 09:45:35,357 http-6060-11 DEBUG anonymous 585x185x1 r8vzf 192.168.15.171 /rest/gadget/1.0/login [httpclient.wire.header] >> "Content-Length: 105[\r][\n]"
2011-12-19 09:45:35,357 http-6060-11 DEBUG anonymous 585x185x1 r8vzf 192.168.15.171 /rest/gadget/1.0/login [httpclient.wire.header] >> "Content-Type: application/xml[\r][\n]"
2011-12-19 09:45:35,357 http-6060-11 DEBUG anonymous 585x185x1 r8vzf 192.168.15.171 /rest/gadget/1.0/login [httpclient.wire.header] >> "[\r][\n]"
2011-12-19 09:45:35,357 http-6060-11 DEBUG anonymous 585x185x1 r8vzf 192.168.15.171 /rest/gadget/1.0/login [httpclient.wire.content] >> "<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>[\n]"
2011-12-19 09:45:35,357 http-6060-11 DEBUG anonymous 585x185x1 r8vzf 192.168.15.171 /rest/gadget/1.0/login [httpclient.wire.content] >> "<password>[\n]"
2011-12-19 09:45:35,357 http-6060-11 DEBUG anonymous 585x185x1 r8vzf 192.168.15.171 /rest/gadget/1.0/login [httpclient.wire.content] >> "    <value>testpw</value>[\n]"
2011-12-19 09:45:35,357 http-6060-11 DEBUG anonymous 585x185x1 r8vzf 192.168.15.171 /rest/gadget/1.0/login [httpclient.wire.content] >> "</password>[\n]"
{code}
* The above contains both the testuser and testpw in plain text.
* Note that it shows the password inputted by the user, which may or may not be the real pw, but in most cases users will have inputted the real pw.

h5. Workaround
Modify the log4j.properties file and adding:
{code}
log4j.logger.httpclient.wire=WARN
{code}
fields.summary: DEBUG logging shows user inputted pw

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26603].
  {panel}

If someone needs additional functionality at MailHandlers it would be usefull to have some more hooks into internal handling:
* beforeSave(GenericValue issue, User reporter, Message message, Comment comment)
* afterSave(GenericValue issue, User reporter, Message message, Comment comment)

Methods should be called in handleMessage(Message message). If you need to change things for issue you can do there before or after saving.
Maybe signature has to be slightly different - I am just starting with JIRA development.

This way you could easily decorate MailHandlers.
fields.summary: Add beforeSave and afterSave to MessageHandler

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26599].
  {panel}

[Jira 4.4.1 release notes|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+4.4.1+Release+Notes] indicate the feature was added to allow administrators to change the ownership of or delete other user's shared filters and dashboards.

However, it is still not possible for an administrator to manage subscriptions created by another user.

This request was part of JRA-11912 which was closed off as a duplicate.  

So while Jira 4.4.1 added the feature to allow editing and deleting filters owned by other people this did not grant the ability to edit subscriptions based off that filter (even with an admin account).
fields.summary: Allow administrators to manage subscriptions
Need a way to stop QuickEdit from reloading the page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26597].
  {panel}

Add more prominant links to our ['Boolean Operators'|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Performing+Text+Searches#PerformingTextSearches-BooleanOperators] section (in our [Performing Text Searches|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Performing+Text+Searches] page) from the [Using Quick Search|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+Quick+Search] and [Advanced Searching|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Searching] pages in our documentation.

In the existing docco, we don't make it clear (i.e. with sufficient examples) about how to refine text searches (by combining search terms with boolean operators).

Clearer examples should definitely be added to the 'Boolean Operators' section - based on the {{field ~ ("blah" AND "blah-dee-blah")}} format.

We should also add similar examples (without explanations) to the appropriate sections of the 'Using Quick Search' and 'Advanced Searching' pages, with links to more detailed explanations of their usage on the 'Performing Text Searches' page.
fields.summary: Make the 'performing text searches' content in the JIRA documentation more prominant + add more examples to help explain its use.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26595].
  {panel}

Hello,


Performing an installation of JIRA5 RC2 on windows I noticed that "data" , "program" and "configs" are very badly separated.
I think it is also true for other Atlassian (and Atlassian is not alone in this :( :( )

During the install you get two questions:
- where to put the program
- where to put the program data (sort of)

So the path I entered where:
- program to "C:\programs"
- data to "MyWebserver"

However what is happening is quite different

program goes to C:\Program Files\Atlassian\JIRA
data goes to ....... C:\Program Files\Atlassian\JIRA\atlassian-jira
all kind of unclear stuff goes to "MyWebserver"
config data goes ......


IMHO a mess!! 


During setup the installer should ask me:
- where to put the program (and only the program, should be read only :( )
- where to put your config
- where to put the site / site data

- and appart from this, the installer should ask:
- should I use your allready present tomcat service
- should I use your apache server?


So IMHO lots of room for (installer) improvement.

Sincerly,


Louis
fields.summary: Data, Program and Config *SHOULD NOT* be in the same path !!!!!!!!!!!!!

fields.description:
I recently upgraded Fisheye/Crucible to use Crowd for authentication, but not my JIRA instance yet.  Application Links/Auth between the 2 atlassian applications will no longer work.

From a specific JIRA project, I attempt to create an Application Link.

I first get 

!authorize.png!

When I click Authorize I get

!approve.png!

And when I allow it I get

!failed.png!

I no longer have integration with my 50+ software project and associated repos.  This prevents my team from creating reviews in a streamlined fashion and has a major impact on my organization.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26591].
  {panel}

(This issue should be an Issue Type of Improvement, not Bug, but I can't change it.) There Currently is a Comments field that you can see when opening an issue however there is not a way to 'display' these Comments when running reports.  I would like to see a scrolling Comments field that will allow you to enter updates about the issue which can hold at least 250 characters.  This way you have the history about the issue and can also add this Comments field to the Issue Navigator section so you can print it on reports.

For Example:  12/1/11 - Mtg schedule to discuss internally with the team. 12/3/11 - Mtg held and Bob will work on the task. 12/5/ 11 - Bob set-up mtg with Joe. 12/11/11 - Joe is working on the issue and ETC is 12/20/11. 

This type of detail is needed for the client.  I have had to manually go into each issue to see the updates and add them manually to my Issue log.
This is creating a lot of extra work for me, while billing the client.  I have attached a copy of the issue log I've been updating.  I also had to delete out the first three rows of the report so I could Filter/Sort issues easily.  I don't find these extra rows helpful.
fields.summary: Comments Column Needed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26580].
  {panel}

When I export search results to an excel. The values of Original Estimate and other time fields are converted to seconds.

For example, the value in JIRA should be 5h, but in excel, it's 18000 seconds. It should be the same as in Issue Navigator.

*WORKAROUND (Copied from JRA-8898):*

As a workaround, it should be possible to define a formula converting the seconds to whatever format is desired (this can then be sorted on too).
fields.summary: Issue Navigator Excel export change time to seconds format

h5. Cause

The 'Anyone' group has been added to certain [Global Permissions|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Global+Permissions] that should not allow it, for example *JIRA System Administrators*.

h5. Resolution

Remove 'Anyone' from *JIRA System Administrators*, *JIRA Administrators* and *JIRA Users*.

(!) Before removing 'Anyone' from *JIRA Users*, ensure that there is a group in there that all your current users who should be able to log in belong to, for example {{jira-users}}. If you remove 'Anyone' from *JIRA Users* and have no replacement group, *no one* will be able to log in except for *JIRA System Administrators* and *JIRA Administrators*.
fields.summary: JIRA freaks out enrolling a user when "Anyone" has the System Admin or Jira Administrator permissions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-26512].
  {panel}

Regarding the basic Issue Navigator search, when you select a project and an issue type as criteria, JIRA will look for all custom fields available in those contexts and will make you able to use only those ones as criteria when searching.

The propose here is: let the user chose any custom field as criteria. If it doesn't match with the available contexts then JIRA should thrown an error message.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Add a new custom field and select Any issue type in the applicable issue types.
2. Go to the Issue navigator and select any of the issue types (the custom fields will be shown under the *Custom Fields* drop-down menu).
3. Edit the same custom field and modify it to have only one applicable issue type (e.g bug)
4. Go to the Issue navigator again, unless you select the issue type bug the custom field will not be displayed under the custom field drop-down menu (so far this is the expected behavior)
fields.summary: Ability to see a custom field for all issue types on the issue navigator, even if this custom field is applicable only in a few contexts.

Hello,

In the latest version of JIRA document, it is clearly stated that "not equals" != operator searches issues which has some value and it is not the specified one.

{quote}
 For example, component != fred will only match issues that have a component and the component is not "fred". To find issues that have a component other than "fred" or have no component, you would need to type: component != fred or component is empty.
{quote}

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Searching#AdvancedSearching-NOTEQUALS

However, in the previous version of JIRA document, it is not described.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA041/Advanced+Searching#AdvancedSearching-NOTEQUALS

Can you modify the above document as well so as to avoid confusion?

Regards,
JP Support

  {panel}

While working on the NYL nbA project we see a need to have new fields added for the "Create Issue" form. We are needing to add 3 new required fields to the "Create Issue" form for our project. This field would default to "blank" and force the user to fill in prior to submitting the issue. 

1. This required field would be called "Specification Doc" and would include the Specification documents written for this project: 
NYL21AE12 Additional Details 
NYL21AE13 User Interface 
NYL21FN01 FileNet 
NYL21IF01_FACTS 
NYL21IF04_nbA Security_SiteMinder_SSO 
NYL21PN01 Policy Numbering 
NYL21PS01 Product Set-up 
NYL21WF02 Workflow 02 
BASE 
NA 
CHANGE CONTROL 

2. This required field would be called "Location" with a drop down list for 'Internal' or 'External'. This is needed so we know which Questions, Issues, Bugs etc should be sent to the client vs. which are Internal issues only. 

3. This required field would be called "Department Affected" with a drop down list for 'Business' or 'Technical'. This way the client will know which type of department should be assigned to the issue.

The JIRA Help Desk person, indicated that this would be considered new development and suggested I submit an issue on this site.
fields.summary: Adding New Fields to the "Create Issue" section
